greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lucky / Unlucky array: Each row starts with n-th lucky number, followed by all unlucky numbers removed at stage n of the sieve.
comment: The array A(row,col) is read by antidiagonals A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), ...
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5995; the first 109 antidiagonals of the array, flattened
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: For col = 1, A(row,col) = A000959(row); otherwise, A(row,col) = A255543(row,col-1).
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (define (A255545bi row col) (if (= 1 col) (A000959 row) (A255543bi row (- col 1))))
xref: Column 1: A000959. Other columns of array as in A255543, e.g. column 2: A219178.
See A255551 for a slightly different variant.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 25 2015
